Package tictactoe

Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
tictactoe.GameLogic
public class GameLogic extends Object
Author:
Filip Vrlec, Florian Naef This class will check if the game is solved or not and contains a few more logic related methods.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLogic

      public GameLogic​(Board b, Player p1, Player p2)
      Parameters:
      b - sets the board to the one chosen
      p1 - sets the player 1, which will be added to the arraylist
      p2 - sets the player 2, which will be added to the arraylist

  • Method Details

    • playerMoves

      public Board playerMoves​(Board board, Player p, Control ctrl)
      Parameters:
      board - uses the board given
      p - uses the player to set the value (X or O)
      ctrl - uses control to add user input
      Returns:
      updated board This method get the user input, asks for user input if it is invalid, makes changes and returns the updated board.

    • gameloop

      public boolean gameloop()

    • checkVertical

      public String checkVertical()
      Returns:
      the result of the game ("nobodyV" = nobody has won the game, "Player " + p.getNumber() + " won" = the game is won) This method checks if the game has been won by placing three same symbols vertically. This has been done by using for each loop and a for loop, which checks every field.

    • checkHorizontal

      public String checkHorizontal()
      Returns:
      the result of the game ("nobodyH" = nobody has won the game, "Player " + p.getNumber() + " won" = the game is won) This method checks if the game has been won by placing three same symbols horizontally. This has been done by using for each loop and a for loop, which checks every field.

    • checkDiagonal

      public String checkDiagonal()
      Returns:
      the result of the game ("nobodyD" = nobody has won the game, "Player " + p.getNumber() + " won" = the game is won) This method checks if the game has been won by placing three same symbols diagonally. This has been done by using for each loop and by using two if statements.
